Posts.Content: txranchmom wrote: Ok I got my cancer diagnosis today's. After finding a lump about 2 months ago, having an ultrasound and mammogram and core needle biopsy. They gave me my pathology report. I have been about run around the Bush with no answers, so need some help.  Just how bad is it? And is it safe to wait a week or week and a half to get in with the breast surgeon? A local surgeon at our small hospital wants to do a lumpectomy, but I'm guarded and would preferr a surgeon skilled in this and more importantly a hospital that is more than a Podunk one. Lol  I'm 34. My report said I had invasive mammary ductal (E-cadherin positive) adenocarcinoma. (Doc right? But I don't know what the positive is?) Historic grade is 6/9 (medium right?) Angiolymphatic Invasive is not identified (good or bad?) Associated DCIS is not identified. (No idea) It's estrogen + (95%) and progesterone + (30%) Her2 negative And the Ki-67 proliferative index is high(25%) Someone please help me figure this out.  On a scale how bad? What the prognosis? Dx 5/29/2014, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 2, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 6/6/2014 Lymph node removal: Right, Sentinel; Mastectomy: Right Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: diagnosed waiting on surgeon consult, need help understanding txranchmom Cuetang

Posts.Content: May 30, 2014 12:32AM txranchmom wrote: Thanks I'll have to go to the Midland/Odessa area for treatment.  Mod thanks for the link, I'd already looked and still can't make heads or tails of it.
Posts.Title: diagnosed waiting on surgeon consult, need help understanding txranchmom Cuetang

Posts.Content: txranchmom wrote: Waiting on results from my biopsy, I get them tomarrow morning.  And I've scoured the internet for all info I can find about a mass with a Bi-rads level of 5 I can find.  But when I first went in, she did blood work. Covered everything except cholesterol.  Anyways my white cell count was normal.  Now I've always heard if you have cancer your white cells are off. BUT I can't find anything to support this.So ladies, any help? Dx 5/29/2014, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 2, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 6/6/2014 Lymph node removal: Right, Sentinel; Mastectomy: Right Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: White cell count? txranchmom wallycat

Posts.Content: May 27, 2014 09:47PM txranchmom wrote: Ok thanks. I have so many what ifs and questions.  If it comes back positive, I don't even know where to go from there. I guess I get referred to an oncologist, but choosing one is hard also.  Hard to know who is good and who isn't.
